thread.title: Are Terrorists Ready for Life After Prison?

author: Nicole Hong
title: Are Terrorists Ready for Life After Prison?
text:
For seven years, Shaker Masri lived behind bars. He passed the days reading dozens of books about Islamic history, trying to untangle what spurred his desire to join a terrorist group overseas, which led to his arrest.
Then, in August 2017, it was time to leave. Prison officials dropped Mr. Masri off at a gas station in eastern Minnesota, where he took the bus to a halfway house in Chicago. He said there was no exit interview, no risk assessment. No one in prison had tried to understand what drew him to jihadist ideology...
